review: A reliable chain restaurant experience. I know CPK gets a bad rap for being crazily unhealthy, but sometimes you just want a cheesy, oily pizza. Or pasta. Or appetizer. Maybe it's something about Saturday nights. Because that's when we came; a Saturday night after a long day of running errands. Tons of people in line, but because there were just two of us, we managed to grab some of the first-come-first-serve sitting room at the bar. CPK had a full house that night, so it took a while for our server, who was also the bartender, to get to us that night, but it was pretty understandable. You know, up until this visit, I didn't realize that this was a "thing" people did: Stand at the bar without grabbing a seat and order drinks. Just a standing bar! No seat required! Maybe I'll try it sometime. But I digress. While service was understandably slow, the bartender/server was extremely friendly and helpful. The drinks were good, the bar area was clean, and, most importantly for our hungry bellies, the food came very quickly! It's CPK, so prices are standard, but it seemed like a decent value to me. If I was feeling a CPKraving, I wouldn't hesitate to visit this location again.

My husband and I went on the fourth of July, so you can imagine it was very dead in there. He ordered a mac and cheese appetizer, I ordered the lettuce wraps, and we ordered our entrees. The server was extremely friendly and made conversation with us, making us very comfortable. Then it all went down hill from there. My lettuce wraps came out but my husband's appetizer didn't. We figured it took a little longer and didn't think anything of it at first. We waited 10 minutes. My husband began to get a little annoyed because he was starving and asked the server about his mac and cheese appetizer and she quickly went to the back to find out what happened to it. She returned within a few minutes to tell us that it should be out in a few minutes. We waited another 15 minutes before she returned with our entrees and an apology about the appetizer. She offered to take the mac and cheese off the bill but my husband declined the order and just enjoyed his pizza, which was Hawaiian BBQ but more bbq than anything else. My Waldorf salad was also soaking in dressing. Huge no no. Anyway, about ten minutes after we got our entrees someone who seemed to be the manager came over to apologize again and told us that she had taken both appetizers off the bill and we could get a free dessert. Great effort on their part but still super annoyed.  I feel really bad for the server bc I imagine it wasn't her fault, but this place really needs to step it up.

Mmm...bland, flavorless, overpriced pizza and a waitress that came by twice after we placed our order until she delivered our check. Not worth the trip. My kids said they really liked their pizza, tho, which is why they got 2 stars.

Food is consistent with their other locations. Service was good. I tend to go with their wide selection of salads.
Food is consistent with their other locations. Service was good. I tend to go with their wide selection of salads.

Let's just say that this wasnt a great experience. I'll start with the fact that Hannah, the hostest was very rude. 2. They initially told us a 15 minute wait and it ended up being over 1 hr. I was travelling with my wife and 3 daughters one of which being 4 months old, this was a complete inconvenience. I will say though that the manager, Steve did come over and rectify, but definitely not a good place on a Saturday night with an infant. p.s. I don't see Hannah's future as a hostess being too bright!

The only other time I've been to a California Pizza Kitchen was in northern Jersey and I have to say I like this one so much better. Maybe because it wasn't as crowded and was way more cozy in this location. For a late Saturday afternoon, there were a good amount of people in there but we still got seated right away and didn't have to wait long for a server to show up. I couldn't believe how fast the food came out, either. The appetizer literally came out minutes after ordering in it which was a pleasant surprise. I don't have anything negative to say. If I lived closer I'd definitely be a regular here.

I do love this place.  You can get pretty much the same meal as a pasta, pizza or salad, in addition to a large menu selection of yummy appetizers and tacos.  The portions are pretty large, and I usually end up sharing or doing halfises because there are too many awesome options. The Thai Chicken salad and/or pizza is great, and I'm looking forward to trying the Spicy Korean BBQ pizza.  Also, the small plate asparagus and arugula salad is really amazing, but the crispy mac and cheese is just okay.  You can't really go wrong here though, so eat up!

An under-utilized dining option at the Macy's wing of the Cherry Hill Mall, California Pizza Kitchen has a menu that delivers on its promise. Take a look at the menu, there's plenty more than pizza. I've been sampling my way around that menu lately, and I've yet to find an item I wasn't pleased with. So far of the pizzas, my favorite is the Roasted Artichoke and Spinach. While these are pizzas it would be nice to share, I embarassingly polished mine off in one sitting. Making happy food noises while I did it too. I dig the lettuce wraps, similar to the ones at PFChangs/Pei Wei. The split pea and barley soup is good. There's flavorful fish tacos.  The new addition section of the menu had a salad that featured quinoa that was good, though the little bits of asparagus in it were a texture disconnect as it was too raw a feeling, when asked what I'd like to add, I learned salmon was an option. It was outstanding. When you dine take-out with them, they are generous with the utensils. When you dine in the restaurant, there's a wonderful selection of drinks. The strawberry pina colada was too good.  The staff is very accommodating and on a recent visit was happy to help our large party out of the who-has-cash-and-who-brought-credit-cards jam by issuing separate checks. The ambiance is good, the music great without being distracting. Full disclosure, this CPK partnered with my store in our Earth Month fundraising with a dining out event. I'm sharing this not just so you know I'm interested in them doing well, but because I would encourage anyone who is looking to do a fundraising event to work with them.  If there's anything I'd have be different it pertains, as usual, to my own selfishness. I'd have them stay open a little later like some of the other restaurants at the Cherry Hill Mall. I'd love to unwind there, or bring home items from their wonderful takeout menu. Alas, with the exception of Sunday, they close at 9:30. Same time the mall closes.

Always a fan of CPK but last visit was just so disappointing.  They have changed up the menu which seems smaller in selections.  Not sure if it's just the Cherry Hill location but the change was clearly not for the better.  From our drinks to sandwiches in was a disappointing experience.  We did speak with the manager and apparently we are not alone in our thoughts.  If it ain't broke don't mess with it. CPK please come back with the old favorites.  Bring back the quality.

I almost wrote off CPK to one sub-par dining experience at the location at City Line Ave. but I'm glad I changed my mind and went to the Cherry Hill location after a long day at the mall. I had a hankering for some BBQ chicken pizza and headed straight over. Hostess was really friendly and asked if we had a seating preference and accommodated our request of a booth next to the TV so we can watch sports.  I was pleased to see they had the thin and crispy option of pizza for $1.25 more. I ordered the BBQ chicken pizza, as I mentioned earlier and the boyfriend had the Habanero Carnitas. Fantastic.  Keep in mind this is a chain restaurant.. next to a MALL... so they get kind of busy.. and there are families with kids. The waiter tried her best to check up on us but we were preoccupied watching the game anyway so it didn't matter to me.

My husband and I are such food snobs that we were never interested in heading to CPK when we lived across the street. We finally had a craving for it so went over on Sunday night. They must've revamped their menu from the last time we were there because it was delicious. Great options! We started with the white corn guac. Delicious! The perfect portion size, too. The guacamole was creamy and light with nice acidic notes from the lime. The corn was an added bonus! I had the Original BBQ Chicken Pizza and the husband had the Habanero Carnitas Pizza. Mine was a classic, good stand by. My husbands was SO GOOD. Perfectly spicy, served with a side of habanero salsa if you wanted the extra kick. The crust was cooked to perfection and all of the flavors melted together just right. Now I want their Thai Chicken Pizza. Darnit!

Being an East Coast guy, I really don't think their pizza stacks up to East Coast standards, or even Chicago for that matter.  Prices are way too high for what they serve. They have a phone app for points that does not work well on Android phones so my phone locked up when the waiter asked me to download it.  Not the best experience and next time... well there probably won't be a next time.

Not impressed with the food here. I had the Hawaiian pizza,$12.75 and still hungry. Overall, just to expensive for just pizza.

Blaring music?  Asked lady that seated us to turn it down. She said "oh yeah it is loud" 10 mins later still up... Listening to Disney-esque country we left.  On the way out I said "we are leaving - the music is unbearable." And she said we can turn it down..." My reply "I asked you that when you seated us but you obviously couldn't even hear me." Off to Brio down the road.   Also we noticed after we left today kids eat free - oh god NO!

CPK please come back with the old favorites.  Bring back the quality.

California Pizza Kitchen (CPK) recently donated food to a local animal rescue event I attended. After trying a sample of their chicken cesar  sandwich, I knew I needed to go and have the full thing.  So on a late Sunday afternoon I battled the parking at the Cherry Hill Mall and made my way to CPK. I was warmly greeted and seated right away in the empty restaurant. It wasn't until a few minutes in that I realized there was outdoor seating- the hostess never offered this.  I didn't even have to look at the menu- as I knew what I was getting. I decided to get an appetizer because I had a free small plate coupon- I went with the mushroom and spinach flat bread- it was delicious and came with 4 reasonably sized pieces. Normally its about $5.  I was happy to see that the chicken cesar salad sandwich came with a side salad that comes out with the dish. The sandwich was as great as I remembered- all of it was delicious. That was until I bit into a cold piece of chicken- very gross.  I expected better service since it was a slow Sunday afternoon. The waitress didn't pay much attention to us, because instead the wait staff was busy socializing. When it came time to pay the bill- the waitress brought over the check. I put my credit card in and waited 15 minutes. Finally after realizing the waitress was too caught up in hanging out I switched my payment to cash and left. I'm not sure the waitress even knew I left. This could be a great place- they have an awesome menu, tons of drinks, a great customer rewards app, and a very cool trendy atmosphere- but they need to pay more attention to detail and their customers.  I won't be writing off California Pizza Kitchen completely, but I don't think I will be visiting this specific location any time soon.
Very good meal while at the mall. Service can be hit or miss depending on who you get. Great make your own pizza for the grandkids.

They mailed me a coupon to my relative's address, so I figured I'd give it a try since it was late -- About 9pm. I sat at the bar to eat, and even though the restaurant was almost empty, the bartender was rude & wouldn't even take my order for a draught beer for about 5 minutes, as he said he had other drinks to make. Then, when the beer came, it was skunky, so I got up & walked out.

My wife and I have had their frozen pizzas before and really enjoy them. We've never eaten in the actual restaurant. We were driving by and decided to stop in for lunch.  She had the White Corn Gauc and Chips and the Bianca Flatbread. She really liked it. I had the Habanero Carnitas Pizza. I highly recommend it. It comes with a spicy salsa on the side which is really hot, but I didn't care for it on my pizza. They specialize in thin and crispy crust (which I like) and all their pizzas are about 10" and perfect for one. Highly recommend the Tiramisu as well.   They have a few other things on the menu besides pizza which we will definitely have to go back and try.

Nice restaurant, friendly service and the Hawaiian pizza and Carnitas Pizza w Habanero Salsa we ordered was delicious! But appetizers were weird tapas sizes... nice outdoor area

Being still new to the area, I'm trying a lot of new places.  This restaurant, as all of them I have been to, is perfect everytime.

I just went to California pizza kitchen for the first time and I have to say it was the best service I ever had. We walked in right after a huge birthday party of about 50 million kids, or so it seemed. Obviously we opted to sit outside. Instead of ignoring us like other restaurants would have, the hostess came out and explained the waiter was also sat with the large party and took our drink order - vodka clubs. It was obvious this was out of her expertise, but kudos to her for taking care of us. Then the manager came out to greet us and ask if we had any questions about the menu while we were waiting. Soon after our waiter came and took out order - white pizzas. They were pretty good but both pies were burnt at the bottom. Considering the immaculate service I'll assume that was a fluke. I'll definitely be going there again!

So we went on a Sunday night because we were craving for some pizza.. There were 5 of us in the party.. The restaurant was dead.. Only 2 customers, which we expected.. So we got seated.. They said the server will be right with you shortly.. Shortly was  "12 minutes" and this was on a dead evening... Gave our orders... And the free table bread came after "15 minutes" unacceptable...and our meal came so late... My thin crust pizza was cold... I think it was left out for a while.. Service sucks... Sorry.... And again.. this was on a Sunday night that was dead.. I can't imagine going to this place on a busy day.

My mom and sister just brought a pizza from this horrible place. They choose the "chipoltle pizza " and I just wanted to report back that it's horrible and way too expensive $14.  It's small and doesn't even look appetizing.   The pizza is garbage, don't get it.
Very good meal while at the mall. Service can be hit or miss depending on who you get. Great make your own pizza for the grandkids.

We decided to come here for lunch after walking out of the Bistro place in the mall because the menu looked boring. We shared the Two In a Bowl and liked it. I thought it was a great idea because we get to taste both soups in one bowl without having to order both of then! We also ordered the Guacamole and Chips and they were good as well. Daughter ordered the Sicilian and hubs ordered the California Veggie pizza with whole wheat grain. We liked the Sicilian but thought the California Veggie was ok. It was a bit healthy! :) Service was friendly. Glad we stopped by! Been a while since we've been to CPK!

Very unprofessional atmosphere. My carryout order wasnt ready over 30 minutes after ordering,  ended up parked in front with my flashers on because all of the "carryout only" spots were occupied by cars obviously not there for carryout. Will not be coming back.

Very unprofessional atmosphere. My carryout order wasnt ready over 30 minutes after ordering,  ended up parked in front with my flashers on because all of the "carryout only" spots were occupied by cars obviously not there for carryout. Will not be coming back.

Terrible service here. Arrived at the front and the hostess asked us to wait while she cleared tables,  in a half full restaurant! Stood for five minutes looking at set tables waiting for permission to be seated.  Once seated waited another five minutes to make our order for drinks.  We were not offered bread and we did not hear the specials. Our waiter was also playing bartender the whole time and still took awhile to get our drinks.  Guacamole was great as was the pizza.  No complaints on the food.  Waiter did not ask how we enjoyed our meal etc. All things considered the food is good but service is terrible.

We ordered take out from here and I told him there was a fly in my salad. He told me that "this has happened before and flys are from the field." That is not an excuse for flies to be in the salad.  See picture  So look out for FLIES in your salads there!!!

We had dinner here with my little family. We come to this place quite often and always loved the place. But that night, I feel the service was a bit short. If not, I wouldv'e give a 4-stars. However the food is always good! My fave is the kungpao spaghetti with shrimp. It's very flavourful!! Always a hit for me! My husband tried the California special pizza ... Which looked very "healthy" with all greens on top of the pizza. But the taste was just nothing special. It's good but nothing to rave about. Then for dessert, we had salted caramel pudding which was beautiful! The sweet and salty sensation is always a delight!

We had dinner here with my little family. We come to this place quite often and always loved the place. But that night, I feel the service was a bit short. If not, I wouldv'e give a 4-stars. However the food is always good! My fave is the kungpao spaghetti with shrimp. It's very flavourful!! Always a hit for me! My husband tried the California special pizza ... Which looked very "healthy" with all greens on top of the pizza. But the taste was just nothing special. It's good but nothing to rave about. Then for dessert, we had salted caramel pudding which was beautiful! The sweet and salty sensation is always a delight!

every time I have been here I've been satisfied! the bbq chicken pizza is great and the last time I got a pear and Gorgonzola pizza topped with arugula salad and toasted hazelnuts - absolutely delicious. I wish they're was a bigger draft beer selection though; literally like only 4 draft beers ha-- They're avocado club egg rolls are delicious as well; definitely taste home made so I asked and our waitress said they make them in house.......and if they actually are getting them in frozen, I need to know where from hahaha.  I'm a big fan of this place and I'm surprised I don't eat here more often then I do.

I am not a fan of chain restaurants but I make an exception for CPK. I like their variety, no matter what I'm in the mood for I know will be delicious. Go to's are BBQ chicken salad and Thai crunch salad, both w/ avocado and I always order half size and pair w/ a small appetizer to share with my boyfriend. The avocado egg rolls are a must, they are so good and filling since it's a large order of 4 cut in half. I tried their margarita last time, refreshing!

We ordered take out from here and I told him there was a fly in my salad. He told me that "this has happened before and flys are from the field." That is not an excuse for flies to be in the salad.  See picture  So look out for FLIES in your salads there!!!

Love the variety of pizzas here and the salads are delicious. The price point is a little high but the quality is always good. They have a few gluten free options that are safe for people with celiac, including a few pizzas that are made separately. They are especially careful and even have the manager oversee the preparation of the gluten free items and bring them out specially to make sure there isn't cross contact.  It's usually not that full so it's a good place to stop while shopping at the cherry hill mall. Or if you're way too busy shopping and don't want to come out and eat, you can have them deliver into the mall.

The food is superb, if you want gooooooooood  pizza, crafted into full flavor, we had good drinks,they gave bread nice and warm with herbs and olive oil, to dip. One word Delicious , the staff was awesome with a friendly a smile that comes with service . My waitress was knowledgeable on the drinks , and food with atmosphere that suits the  family's and its not just pizza . Most of all Clean! My first time here , I'm sold,and we will  be back.

If I could give this place zero stars I would. I am absolutely appalled by the service I received. I have been here on a few other occasions and received mediocre service, but today was the last time I could deal. My mother, myself, and my boyfriend came here for drinks and appetizers, and was met with a disheveled incompetent server who placed us at a table with no place settings. We ordered our drinks, wine and cocktails, and glasses of water. Also placed an appetizer order. 10 minutes later, no water, and we are placing our lunch orders. The bartender is obviously too busy conversing with the kitchen to make our drinks. And out comes the appetizer. But no water. When we questioned this, the expeditor looked at us blankly. A manager was requested and the appetizer was sent back with our server, who by this time had displayed a level of incompetence that is exemplary at this time. Excuse after excuse  "I'm new" "I don't drink so I don't know what beers are on tap" "This isn't my section" Needless to say we left shortly after with no waters still

I visit this place twice and both times I got two completely different service. This Saturday March 5,16 I visit this restaurant. Let me start from when i step my foot in the door. There where people standing and sitting in the waiting area. So I already knew it was going to be a wait. As we approach the host stand we were greeted properly. We where given a 30-35min wait time. We where fine with that. (Last visit the hosts where very disorganized)So me and my girlfriends decide to go to the bar to have a drink or two while we wait for our table. First things I notice is that it was type cold inside. The heat needed to be turn up some.(last time is was nice and warm)We sat at the bar and the bartender was making a drink. First thing I notice was the way his face was all screw up. He looked like he hated his job. It took him 10min to approach us. When he do  he acted like we was disturbing him. So we didn't bother getting his name. After We receive our drinks. We drink quickly. Then we went back to the front.(last time the bartender was friendly and cheerful. A bartender name worth remembering Craig). 5min after returning to the waiting area. Our names was call. The server greeted us properly. Marissa was friendly and aware of the menu. We need more servers like her.(last time the server Stevie was unaware of the menu. Took for ever to greet us and took for ever to check us out). The meal was great. Both visit! Good job kitchen. The only thing that bug me was the Guy Supervisor sweeping under the table while we eat. Like hello sweep when people are not eating at the table. After dinner we our server check us out promptly. This place has its off and on days just cross your finger you go the right day!!!

Pizza is very good. I'm a little disappointed in how they handle the take out parking. Take out parking should be for customers using the take out service. On my visit last night my vechile was almost hit by someone who utilized the take out parking to sit and eat in the establishment. When I mentioned it to the girl in front her answer was "Yes I know they parked there people do it all the time.. sorry that happened". If they aren't going to enforce the parking spot reserved for take out why have it. I was very disappointed in that statement.

Waited 50 minutes for our meal. Everyone seated well after us was served well before us. We had to take our meal to go. They failed to provide utensils, the pita was raw/hummus bland, and they forgot the salad dressing. Side note, the pizza was just bad. I suggest they change their name or stop serving pizza.

Great family restaurant. Plenty of choices. Reasonable prices. The Jamaican Jerk pizza is to die for.

This  CPK has gone wayyyyy downhill lately. It used to be our go to take-out place. Recently (last year or so), the service has gone down hill. I thought it was just busy in the past, but tonight we ordered ahead, and went in exactly when it said our order would be done. Guess what!? It wasn't. It was mostly empty, so what were they doing for those 20 minutes when we had called ahead? We had to sit and wait 7 minutes. I know it's not long, but it's disappointing. The hostess didn't apologize for the wait. We got the order home, and the salads didn't even have what we ordered on them. We paid extra for avocado, yet it wasn't there. The lack of attention to detail and poor service have me avoiding this CPK now.

Great family restaurant. Plenty of choices. Reasonable prices. The Jamaican Jerk pizza is to die for.

I eat at CPKs all over the country. It's almost impossible to have a bad experience. This one is an exception. I've eaten here many times, and although I've had several reasonably average experiences, most of the time something goes wrong. It might be a long delay in getting your food, or  inexperienced service, or a dish that you've had many times that's not quite right. Or it might be that the music is really loud on the patio, to the point where the speakers are distorting. Or It might be that the lights on the patio are really bright like you're in a diner. Or it might be that no one is there to greet you when you arrive at the podium. Something is almost always slightly off.  I can only assume it's a management problem.

Well, the atmosphere is neat. The host sat us and befire we could check out the menu, our server was already asking if we'd like a drink. Lydia, our server was  very nice, and attentive.  The restaurant got a little busy while  we were there.  They handled it well. The only issue i really took was with the person that seemed to be the manager doing paperwork at the bar. He saw that there was a small group at the door, and instead of assisting them, he threw his hands up and exclaimed, "There are seven people at the door!" It was quite a turn off. The staff overall was upbeat and pleasant.

WORST PIZZA OF MY LIFE! Everything from the food to the service was absolutely terrible! First of all there were crumbs on my seat which I noticed after I had sat down. Second the waiter brought us stale bread which we didn't care about because we were there for the pizza. Thirdly, the marinara sauce for our rolls was cold. Fourth, the tostada pizza we had ordered had most of the salad in the middle, barely had any herb ranch sauce and what is supposed to be a crispy pizza was hard and chewy! The waiter took away food and plates before we were even done eating. The food was barely edible and was completely disappointed as I had heard some great things about CPK! I definitely will not be returning. COMPLETE TRASH! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!

In complete honesty, probably the best pizza I've ever had in my life. My girlfriend and I always have the desire to come to CPK whenever we get the chance, and it's always amazing. In Cherry Hill, the service is quick and friendly. Today we had a very kind waiter named Patrick. He was very comforting and not too nudgy. Excellent service! Just a little pricey, taking away a star, but overall amazing experience! Will be returning!!!

In Cherry Hill, the service is quick and friendly. Today we had a very kind waiter named Patrick. He was very comforting and not too nudgy. Excellent service! Just a little pricey, taking away a star, but overall amazing experience! Will be returning!!!

The food is superb, if you want gooooooooood  pizza, crafted into full flavor, we had good drinks,they gave bread nice and warm with herbs and olive oil, to dip. One word Delicious , the staff was awesome with a friendly a smile that comes with service . My waitress was knowledgeable on the drinks , and food with atmosphere that suits the  family's and its not just pizza . Most of all Clean! My first time here , I'm sold,and we will  be back.

Usually live this place but holy crap have they gone downhill.   Maybe just hit a really bad night but it wasn't crazy busy but the chef completely ruined two cedar plank Salmons in a row.  Sent first back because it was way way over cooked.  Second one was worse than the first.  Both inedible.  Shame... used to love that dish.  Will try again in a few months.

Usually live this place but holy crap have they gone downhill.   Maybe just hit a really bad night but it wasn't crazy busy but the chef completely ruined two cedar plank Salmons in a row.  Sent first back because it was way way over cooked.  Second one was worse than the first.  Both inedible.  Shame... used to love that dish.  Will try again in a few months.

Very hesitant to come here after reading all the reviews, but we already had a 7party group plan to come here so I went, now I regret spending my money here. Waiter was pretty busy, seems like they're understaffed. Pizza is overpriced and not even remotely worth the price of the meals. There were 7 of us and we all got a different pizza, all with the reaction that it was O.K. Meal wasn't worth $269, it's worth $150. Quality isn't that great at all to be driving from Philadelphia to New Jersey. Drinks were NOT made right. They all had too little or too much alcohol. (that's 7 messed up drinks, 7 meh pizzas) Overall experience is that it's an ok place, but I would not both driving a long way here nor would I pay this much for mediocre pizza. Would not go here again. Bread and oil was like someone who doesn't know how to cook mushing all those ingredients together, did not taste good. Same with the rest of the food we got. Especially the pizza.

I would give zero stars if possible. I've been to many of the CKP locations and they are great but not this one. Yesterday I popped in for lunch and it was horrible. The hostess sat me at a table that was not cleaned yet even though there were many clean unoccupied tables. My waiter came over to clean table but he just wiped a dry rag over the table. I called him back to rewipe when I saw there were food crumbs still all over. My dining companion and I ordered our food at 3:02pm exactly. 3:36 rolls by and still no food or explanation. Our waiter was no where to be found, then I find him. I ask what is going on and he waves me off and says "oh they gave your food to someone else". No apologies,no one came to let us know anything! Finally our food came and by this time we were both annoyed. The food was sub par and we needed more water but AGAIN could not find our waiter. We will not be back. There are too many places that are better in service and food by the mall. They have very good red  velvet cake , yesterday I didn't even bother bc service was so bad

After these reviews I was nervous about coming. However the service was great and so were the margaritas! The Sicilian pizza was great and the BBQ chicken salad was very good. The place was so clean which is really what caught our eye. We will def be back

One of my favorite pizza(and more) places. We have honestly only gone when we can eat outside as we love to eat alfresco. Tried pizza, pasta, guacamole(and umm $4.99?! Yes please!) had egg rolls too. Kids had from pasta to pizza. Only giving 4 stars bc the egg rolls were super greasy.

I am surprised to see so many poor experiences here. I have been here a little over a handful of times over the past years and never had a bad experience I can remember. I do know they become quite busy so it is always wise to call ahead if planning to attend during traditional lunch or dinner hours.  My most recent visit was Veterans Day for their special (I am a Combat Veteran). I believe I came in around 0830-0900pm. I sat at their bar where you can watch the brick ovens. There was plenty of room. I believe at the time only one other gentleman was seated there. The waiter/bartender came over, explained the specials to me and asked me what I'd like to drink. I ordered a beer and asked if he could put the Flyers game in the tv closest to me and he did. I ordered a pizza, enjoyed the beer and enjoyed the pizza when it came. It did not take long for my order. The bartender checked in regularly and we shared in some conversation. It was a pleasant experience.

Came here for a quick dinner as the other mall options were swamped with '17 grads. I started with the Split Pea and Barley which was good.                                                                              For dinner the wife had the Grilled Chicken Salad which she enjoyed. The salad was fresh and the chicken was seasoned and grilled perfectly. I had the Zucchini Shrimp Scampi. For the sake of time, in one word Terrible. Bland on all levels. All kitchens have off days even ours so we will come back for the Pizza. We gave it 3 stars because the service was very good.
Undercooked and doohey.... what I would call cheesey bread not pizza.  Got the chicken dumpling app and it was soogy and had hard pieces of something in it.  Way overpriced!   So many better options

In short: food was fine, service was okay - nothing about our experience really stood out as horrible or excellent....  We were seated at a table that hadn't been properly cleaned so it wasn't set & there were crumbs around. Not great, but no big deal. We ordered drinks & food, it came out approximately 15 minutes later and everything was fine. The only standout was the buffalo cauliflower, which satisfied a craving I had all week. It was fairly slow at the time we came in but most of the staff seemed disinterested. I've been here before & had better experiences, so maybe it was just an off night... Oh well.

Good pizza with many other selections good for a stop out of the mall with good pizza and many fun selection of flavors and grate service
Good pizza with many other selections good for a stop out of the mall with good pizza and many fun selection of flavors and grate service

I ate at California pizza kitchen Few times in he past maybe 3+ years ago. I have been mostly going to blaze pizza once opened up nearby and since I have not been there for a few years i said this will be a good time to check it out on my way back from Washington DC trip and a pit stop in Cherry Hill. Wow all I will say they will need to change business model soon as Blaze pizza will hands down destroy them when it comes to coal fired pizza. We ordered a plain pie  for the kids to split and when it was ordered I just said 1 kids pizza to split as kids were not that hungry. We also ordered 2 salads to keep it light, 1 half size w chicken 15$ and full size arugula and Quinoa with Salmon 19$. I also ordered Moscow mule 10$. The salads below average very plain not tasty you would expect a lot more for the price paid. Honesty I had better almost any place I can think of. The drink way too sweet the worst Moscow mule I had. All I tasted was lime juice and no alcohol. Now to the pizza, it looked like a good size kids pizza with way too much crust , it turned out this was a regular size pizza that was 11.99!! Wow.. the waitress ended  up changing it it to 5.99 but kind of put it on me that I didn't explain?? What is there to explain I ordered plain pizza to split for my 4 year old kids to split from the children's menu? The kids pizza is super small as I have peeked and seen from another family nearby! We are used to paying 5$ for super nice Blaze pizza much tastier with no huge crust which we all know kids don't like. Service overall below mediocre Waitress disappeared for 10+ minutes and had to ask around for out waitress as we had to leave. I will never come back to this place period, waste of money And no value at all. This business coal fired pizza model restaurant need to change before I visit for now I will stick with Applebees and Blaze pizza for much better quality service and food!

Food was okay, nothing to brag about. The prices for the food are high for what you get. People were kind but one worker that was upfront was rude. Overall it was okay.
Food was okay, nothing to brag about. The prices for the food are high for what you get. People were kind but one worker that was upfront was rude. Overall it was okay.
I'm a CPK fan. This location is great as well. Every time I go here there isn't a wait. Considering nobody was in the restaurant, the food came slow.
I'm a CPK fan. This location is great as well. Every time I go here there isn't a wait. Considering nobody was in the restaurant, the food came slow.

I haven't been to CPK since moving away from California. This is a really good chain restaurant. I got the CPK BBQ chicken salad and my fiancé got the Carne Asada Pizza and a Mango Lemonade. Free Refills!  No complaints. Service was good. My salad was really fresh. CPK always has fresh salad. The lettuce is never wilted and the vegetables don't seem that they have been sitting around all day. My fiancé enjoyed his pizza and his lemonade and got a refill.  I recommend going here while at the mall for a nice, filling, affordable and chill meal

Nothing too special. Price was a bit much for what they had to offer. Very friendly staff. Restaurant had a nice ambience. The California Veggie Pizza was great, but the ham in the Hawaiian Pizza was way over salted. Iced Tea was $3 and we did not get free refills as the menu promised. Two pizzas and 4 Iced teas came out to $40

Two pizzas and 4 Iced teas came out to $40

Came here for a quick dinner as the other mall options were swamped with '17 grads. I started with the Split Pea and Barley which was good.                                                                              For dinner the wife had the Grilled Chicken Salad which she enjoyed. The salad was fresh and the chicken was seasoned and grilled perfectly. I had the Zucchini Shrimp Scampi. For the sake of time, in one word Terrible. Bland on all levels. All kitchens have off days even ours so we will come back for the Pizza. We gave it 3 stars because the service was very good.

The first time I came here was on 4/26/14 and then I came back on 1/1/5. This is a good restaurant with different types of varieties. This was my 3rd time here (8/12/17) and I ordered Pepperoni and Sausage pizza. It's really good. They do serve bread which is also good. The staff here are nice and friendly.

Came to have dinner with family from a long distance. Good quality does not compare to other CPK locations. Food was served cold.  Service was very poor. Half way done with the eating, they brought the truffle oil that should have been served with the pizza.  Would not recommend or come back.

Terrible terrible service. Came in when it was completely empty, they took forever to take care of us. Food was cold, the order was wrong. We asked for sides like truffle oil and jalapeno peppers which were not brought till half way through our meal. I wouldn't recommend coming here.

Terrible terrible service. Came in when it was completely empty, they took forever to take care of us. Food was cold, the order was wrong. We asked for sides like truffle oil and jalapeno peppers which were not brought till half way through our meal. I wouldn't recommend coming here.

Good quality food and extensive menu. Came in when it was not busy, but received sub standard service. Some of the specifications we made for the order were not met and some of the food was colder than it should be. We asked for specific additions on menu items but those were not included with our order. Cheque took an abnormally long time to come the table. Waiter did take off 10% off of menu items for the mistake.

After these reviews I was nervous about coming. However the service was great and so were the margaritas! The Sicilian pizza was great and the BBQ chicken salad was very good. The place was so clean which is really what caught our eye. We will def be back

One of my favorite pizza(and more) places. We have honestly only gone when we can eat outside as we love to eat alfresco. Tried pizza, pasta, guacamole(and umm $4.99?! Yes please!) had egg rolls too. Kids had from pasta to pizza. Only giving 4 stars bc the egg rolls were super greasy.

This place is disgusting. The bacon on my husband's sandwich and salad has some kind of fake smoked taste, the guac was absolutely disgusting, the ingredients in bothb our dishes were just poor quality. My server could care less. I didn't see a manager the whole time we were here. This place is just sucks, the quality of food and service is below par. With all the restaraunts in and around the mall I have no idea how this place stays in business. I won't be back and I'll make sure to share my experience with fiends and family.

I always love coming here to as often as possible to get a quick bite! My favorite is "The Works " pizza.....and I get it without olives. Very fast, friendly service!

Undercooked and doohey.... what I would call cheesey bread not pizza.  Got the chicken dumpling app and it was soogy and had hard pieces of something in it.  Way overpriced!   So many better options

The first time I came here was on 4/26/14 and then I came back on 1/1/5. This is a good restaurant with different types of varieties. This was my 3rd time here (8/12/17) and I ordered Pepperoni and Sausage pizza. It's really good. They do serve bread which is also good. The staff here are nice and friendly.

Eh. I haven't been here in at least 5-6 years and I only came because a friend had a gift card they won at work. It's decent pizza for lunch I'll put it that way. The pizza is more of a large personal pizza and a small sharing pizza. I got the shrimp scampi pizza I think, acceptable. The feel of the place is weird, imagine a local pizzeria but renovated and larger, that's the vibe I get from this place. It's not horrible but it's not amazing, but definitely get their ranch. It's a buttermilk ranch with dill in it and probably the best thing there for my ranch lovers.
